definitions.example: I stopped at the traffic lights.

definitions.definition: To cause (something) to cease moving or progressing.
definitions.example: The sight of the armed men stopped him in his tracks.

definitions.definition: To cease; to no longer continue (doing something).
definitions.example: One of the wrestlers suddenly stopped fighting.

definitions.definition: To cause (something) to come to an end.
To close or block an opening.
definitions.example: He stopped the wound with gauze.

definitions.definition: (often with "up" or "down") To adjust the aperture of a camera lens.
definitions.example: To achieve maximum depth of field, he stopped down to an f-stop of 22.

definitions.definition: To stay; to spend a short time; to reside or tarry temporarily.
definitions.example: He stopped at his friend's house before continuing with his drive.

definitions.definition: To regulate the sounds of (musical strings, etc.) by pressing them against the fingerboard with the finger, or otherwise shortening the vibrating part.
The act of something that stops; a halt.
A partition or door to direct or prevent a current of air.
A pad or poultice of dung or other material applied to a horse's hoof to keep it moist.
